t: Job 16
Job Reproaches His Pitiless Friends
Then*p Job answered and said:
“I*pn have heard many such things; Miserable*ld comforters are*i you all!
Shall*ld words of wind have an end? Or*ld what provokes you that you answer?
I*ld also could speak as you do,*i If*ld your soul were in my soul’s place. I*ld could heap up words against you, And*ld shake my head at you;
But*ild I would strengthen you with my mouth, And*ld the comfort of my lips would relieve your*i grief.*i
“Though*ln I speak, my grief is not relieved; And*ld if*i I remain silent, how am I eased?
But*ld now He has worn me out; You*ld have made desolate all my company.
You*ld have shriveled me up, And*ld it is a witness against*i me;*i My*ld leanness rises up against me And*ild bears witness to my face.
He*ld tears me*i in His wrath, and hates me; He*ld gnashes at me with His teeth; My*ld adversary sharpens His gaze on me.
They*ld gape at me with their mouth, They*ld strike me reproachfully on the cheek, They*ld gather together against me.
God*ld has delivered me to the ungodly, And*ld turned me over to the hands of the wicked.
I*ld was at ease, but He has shattered me; He*ld also has taken me*i by my neck, and shaken me to pieces; He*ld has set me up for His target,
His*ld archers surround me. He*ld pierces my heart and does not pity; He*ld pours out my gall on the ground.
He*ld breaks me with wound upon wound; He*ld runs at me like a warrior.
“I*ln have sewn sackcloth over my skin, And*ld laid my head in the dust.
My*ld face is flushed from weeping, And*ld on my eyelids is*i the shadow of death;
Although*ld no violence is*i in my hands, And*ld my prayer is*i pure.
“O*ln earth, do not cover my blood, And*ld let my cry have no resting*i place!
Surely*ld even now my witness is*i in heaven, And*ld my evidence is*i on high.
My*ld friends scorn me; My*ld eyes pour out tears*i to God.
Oh,*ld that one might plead for a man with God, As*ld a man pleads*i for his neighbor!
For*ld when a few years are finished, I*ld shall go the way of no return.
